1:
Yahweh my God, I take refuge in you!\q Save me from all who chase me, and rescue me.
\q
2:
Otherwise, they will rip me apart like a lion,\q tearing me in pieces with no one else able to bring me to safety.


\q
3:
Yahweh my God, if I have done this, \q and there is guilt on my handsâ€”
\q
4:
if I have done evil to him who was at peace with me,\q or senselessly harmed my enemy without cause, then hear my words.


\q
5:
Then let my enemy pursue my life and overtake me;\q let him trample my life to the ground
\q and lay my honor in the dust.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
7:
The countries are assembled all around you;\q take once more your rightful place over them.


\q
8:
Yahweh, judge the nations;\q vindicate me, Yahweh, because I am righteous and innocent, Most High.
\q
9:
May the evil deeds of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous people,\q righteous God, you who examine hearts and minds.


\q
10:
My shield comes from God,\q the one who saves the upright in heart.
\q
11:
God is a righteous judge,\q a God who is indignant each day.


\q
12:
If a person does not repent, God will sharpen his sword\q and will prepare his bow for battle.
\q
13:
He prepares to use weapons against him;\q he makes his arrows flaming shafts.


\q
14:
Think about the one who is pregnant with wickedness,\q who conceives destructive plans, who gives birth to harmful lies.
\q
15:
He digs a pit and hollows it out\q and then falls into the hole he has made.
\q
16:
His own destructive plans return to his own head,\q for his violence comes down on his own head.

 
\q
17: I will give thanks to Yahweh for his justice;\q I will sing praise to Yahweh Most High.
